nav.div: Concord School District » News » What's New » In-Depth School and Community

br.span: Dr. Bass sits down with attorney Dean Eggert and Dr. Matthew Gibb from Concord Hospital to talk about how their respective fields have handled the COVID-19 health crisis so far.
Dr. Bass and Business Administrator Jack Dunn have a discussion with NH Senators Soucy and Feltes about how community and state have responded to the COVID-19 crisis.
Concord School District Assistant Superintendent Donna Palley and Business Administrator Jack Dunn join Superintendent Bass to discuss many details of the new remote learning plan.
Concord School District Superintendent Frank Bass is joined by Matt Cashman and Pam McLeod to discuss changes in facilities and technology in the school district.
NH Education Commissioner Frank Edelblut and State Rep. David Luneau join Dr. Frank Bass in a conversation about the implementation of remote learning during the COVID-19 pandemic.

br.span: The shift to remote learning is a big adjustment for everyone involved but a lot of progress has been made. Check out this episode in which we hear from Concord High School student Nick Richards, CHS teacher and parent Kelly Noel, as well as CHS program assistant and parent Jessica Jordan. They tell us about how the process is going so far for them!

div.p: Our vision is that all Concord students develop a passion for learning, experience excellence in their lives and believe that they have the ability to shape the future of their lives and communities.
